ModMetaData.name: Scarring Infections
ModMetaData.author: Hexicube
ModMetaData.description:
Infections are no longer immediately lethal, and instead scar the body part first.
Infections will scar body parts: - Body part scarring occurs at 90-95% infection, unless immunity is developed. - Scarring causes the infection to recede 2%, and deduct 0.5-2hp from the body part. - Once a scar has fully disabled the body part (strength equal to hp), infections are lethal.
Pawns will not die from their very first infection, unless untreated. - Pawns will die from an untreated arm (30hp) infection with immunity ending at about 90%. - Pawns can potentially survive an untreated torso (40hp) infection.
Pawns may survive treatment without medicine, but will scar unless they are super-immune. - No-medicine treatment could cause up to 20hp of scarring, depending on treatment quality. - Some body parts (i.e. eyes) don't have the hp to cover this, therefore the pawn would die.
Mod can be removed from saves, but infection scars will remain.
